metadata.title: CVE-2020-0429 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In l2tp_session_delete and related functions of l2tp_core.c, there ispossible memory corruption due to a use after free. This could lead tolocal escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. Userinteraction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions:Android kernelAndroid ID: A-152735806

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0429` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-179-generic - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-4.4.0-179-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-4.4.0-179-lowlatency - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-179-generic - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-179-lowlatency - 4.4.0-179.209
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-179.209').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1071.78').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1107.118').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.33~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1008.10~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1133.142').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1137.145').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1034.39').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
